document.heading: Homeland Security, Risk Reduction, and Preparedness Amendment Act of 2006

history.narrative: Law 16-262, the “Homeland Security, Risk Reduction, and Preparedness Amendment Act of 2006”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-242, which was referred to Committee on Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 5, 2006, and December 19, 2006, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 28, 2006, it was assigned Act No. 16-618 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-262 became effective on March 14, 2007.
